qas.question: What was the first station launched after the original BBC?
What was the third network started in the UK?
What prevented BBC2 from broadcasting on its scheduled launch date?
Where was the cause of the power outage?
Who served as MC for the first BBC2 broadcast?
What channel was launched that caused BBC TV to be renamed BBC2?
Where did the fire at Battersea Station Power cause a massive power failure?

plausible_answers.text: A videotape made on the opening night was rediscovered

qas.question: What was discovered in 2003 by an ITV technician?
What was the first channel to use UHF and 405-line pictures?

context: BBC TV was renamed <b5_0>BBC1<b5_0/> in 1964, after the launch of <a1_0>BBC2<a1_0/> (now BBC Two), the third television station (<a0_0>ITV<a0_0/> was the second) for the UK; its remit, to provide more niche programming. The channel was due to launch on <b6_0>20 April 1964<b6_0/>, but was put off the air by a <a2_0>massive power failure<a2_0/> that affected much of <b7_0>London<b7_0/>, caused by a fire at <a3_0>Battersea Power Station<a3_0/>. <b8_0>A videotape made on the opening night was rediscovered<b8_0/> in 2003 by a BBC technician. In the end the launch went ahead the following night, hosted by <a4_0>Denis Tuohy<a4_0/> holding a candle. <b9_0>BBC2<b9_0/> was the first British channel to use UHF and 625-line pictures, giving higher definition than the existing VHF 405-line system.
